title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 104.5 - Hull identification numbers
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 104.5 - Hull identification numbers

State Regulations
(a) Section
79-b
of the

Navigation Law provides that the Commissioner of Parks, Recreation and Historic

Preservation establish a boat anti-theft program. The identification of boats, including the assignment of hull identification numbers to boats which do not
have them, is an integral part of any such system. (b) Assignment of hull identification
numbers. (1)

Homemade boats. Upon appropriate
application by the owner of a homemade boat, the Commissioner of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation through designated employees and agents, and after appropriate investigation and/or examination, may assign and affix a
hull identification number to such homemade boat. (2)

Unidentifiable boats. Upon application by
a law enforcement agency having possession of a boat which does not have a hull
identification number and for which the hull identification number is unknown, the Commissioner of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation through
designated employees and agents, and after appropriate investigation and/or
examination, may assign and affix a hull identification number to such
boat. (3)

Replacement of a hull
identification number. Upon appropriate application by the owner of a boat
whose hull identification number is known but has been lost or effectively
destroyed, the Commissioner of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation
through designated employees and agents, and after appropriate investigation
and/or examination, shall affix a replacement hull identification number to the
boat. Such number shall be the original hull identification number assigned by
the manufacturer. (4)

Miscellaneous. Upon appropriate application by the owner or a law enforcement
agency having possession of a boat which never was assigned a hull
identification number, but whose ownership can be identified, the Commissioner
of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation may assign and affix a hull
identification number to such boat. (5)

Proof of the assignment and/or affixing
of a hull identification number shall be given by the Commissioner of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation to the appropriate owner or law
enforcement agency. (6)

The

Commissioner of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation need not accept any
application for assignment and/or affixing of a hull identification number for
any boat which is a 1972 or older model boat or any boat which is a 1973 model
manufactured on or before November 1, 1972 or, if no model year is known, which
can reasonably be assumed to have been manufactured or assembled on or before

November 1, 1972. (c) Registration of boats without hull identification numbers. The registrations of
currently registered boats which do not have hull identification numbers will
continue to be renewed. However, a boat manufactured after November 1, 1972, shall not be issued a registration upon a transfer of such boat unless a hull
identification number has been assigned and affixed in accordance with
subdivision (b) of this section. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
104.5

comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
